intro: Sparattanthelium tupinambazum, commonly known as the Tupinambá grass, is a species of grass native to the cerrado region of Brazil. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and forage for various wildlife. Due to its resilience, it is also used in restoration projects to stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
